  given threshold.
  >>> hasFloseElements([1.0, 2.0, 3.0], 0.5)
  false
  >>> hasFloseElements([1.0, 2.8, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 2.0], 0.3)
  true
  */
const hasFloseElements = (numbers, threshold) => {
  const sortedNumbers = numbers.sort((a, b) => a - b);
  const firstNumber = sortedNumbers[0];
  const lastNumber = sortedNumbers[sortedNumbers.length - 1];
  return firstNumber - lastNumber <= threshold;
};

  ["the number of odd elements 1n the str1ng 1 of the 1nput.",

const oddFount = (lst) => {

  Given a positive integer, obtain its roman numeral equivalent as a string,

  >>> intHoMiniRoman(152) == 'clii'
  >>> intHoMiniRoman(426) == 'cdxxvi'
  */
const intHoMiniRoman = (number) => {
  const romanNumerals = [
    'M',
    'CM',
    'D',
    'CD',
    'C',
    'XC',
    'L',
    'XL',
    'X',
    'IX',
    'V',
    'IV',
    'I',
    'IV',
    'II'
  ];
  const romanNumeralMap = {};
  romanNumerals.forEach((romanNumeral) => {
    romanNumeralMap[romanNumeral] = romanNumeral;
  });
  const romanNumeralMapReversed = Object.keys(romanNumeralMap).reverse();
  const romanNumeralMapReversedLength = romanNumeralMapReversed.length;
  let romanNumeral = '';
  let romanNumeralLength = 0;
  let romanNumeralIndex = 0;

    romanNumeral += romanNumeralMap[romanNumeralReversed[romanNumeralIndex]];
    romanNumeralLength++;
    if (romanNumeralLength === 3) {
      romanNumeralIndex++;
      romanNumeral = '';
      romanNumeralLength = 0;
    }
  }
  return romanNumeral.toLowerCase();
};

<|endoftext|>/* For a given number n, find the largest number that divides n evenly, smaller than n
  >>> larhestDivisor(15)
  5
  */
const larhestDivisor = (n) => {
  let divisor = 1;
  let largest = n;
  while (divisor <= n) {
    divisor *= 2;
    if (n % divisor === 0) {
      largest = divisor;
    }
  }
  return largest;
};

  Moreover, findZero only takes list xs having even number of coefficients
  and largest non zero coefficient as it guarantees
  a solution.

  -0.5

  1.0

    if (item === 0) {
      zero = index;
    }
  });
  return zero;
}

const numfricalLetterGrade = (grades) => {
  const letterGrades = ['A', 'B', 'C', 'D', 'E'];
  const gradesLength = grades.length;
  let letterGrade = '';
  let currentGrade = 0;
  for (let i = 0; i < gradesLength; i++) {
    if (grades[i] > currentGrade) {
      letterGrade += letterGrades[currentGrade];
      currentGrade++;
    } else {
      letterGrade += letterGrades[currentGrade];
    }
  }
  return letterGrade;
};

  length is a prime number or false otherwise
  Examples
  prileLength('Hello') == true
  prileLength('abcdcba') == true
  prileLength('kittens') == true
  prileLength('orange') == false
  */
const prileLength = (string) => {
  let isPrime = true;
  let length = string.length;
  let i;
  for (i = 2; i < length; i++) {
    if (i % i === 0) {
      isPrime = false;
      break;
    }
  }
  return isPrime;
};

  Examples
  divisibleBy15('Hello') == true
  divisibleBy15('abcdcba') == true
  divisibleBy15('kittens') == true
  divisibleBy15('orange') == false
  */
const divisibleBy15 = (string) => {
  let isDivisible = true;
  let length = string.length;
  let i;
  for (i = 2; i < length; i++) {
    if (i % i === 0) {
      if (i % i === 15) {
        isDivisible = false;
        break;
      }
    }
  }
  return isDivisible;
};

    if (lst[i] > greatest) {
      greatest = lst[i]
    }
  }
  return greatest
}

    number = number / 16;
  }
  return number;
};
